title: Time vs Tip
question_text:
Do customers who shop for a longer time in a store spend more money?
Charlotte, an AP Statistics student who worked at the mall, decided to investigate this question. Over the course of the next few months, she obtained a random sample of receipts, which included the length of time (in minutes) the shopper spent at the mall and the total amount the shopper spent (in dollars). Here is regression output for the data Charlotte collected:
Tip (dollars) versus Time (minutes)
PredictorCoefSE Coef$T$$ P$
Constant$4.535$$1.657$$2.74$$0.021$
Time$0.03013$$0.02448$$0.247$
$S = 1.77931$R-sq = $13.2$%R-sq (adj) = $4.5$%
Based on this output, what is the correct value for the $t$ test statistic for determining whether those who stay longer spend more?
